page.title: 19CLUBS AND RECREATION
page.content: Dunmow Youth Club meets on Thursday and Monday evenings for children of 10 to 18 years at the youth centre which is next door to the library.The Guides Brownies,Cubs and Scouts were founded by Lord and Lady Baden Powell,their aim is to help everybody.There are 3 packs of Brownies in Dunmow,one pack meets in St Mary's Hall.The cubs and Scouts meet at the Scout Hut down Mill Fields.The children meet together each week to work for badges,learn new skills and sing and play together.The Cubs and Scouts often go away camping. The Womens Institute meet every second Wednesday of the month in the Foakes Hall,they have speakers in and they raise money for charity.The Dunmow Floral group also meets in this hall once a month on a Wednesday.The Foakes Hall is hired out for plays,antique sales,meetings and other social events
